com.soa.agent.servlet
Class MPHttpServletRequestWrapper

java.lang.Object
  javax.servlet.ServletRequestWrapper
      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequestWrapper
          com.soa.agent.servlet.MPHttpServletRequestWrapper
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, javax.servlet.ServletRequest
public class MPHttpServletRequestWrapper
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequestWrapper

Wraps an HttpServletRequest object so that it can be passed safely through a filter chain that may change the original request.

Method Detail

getInputStream

public javax.servlet.ServletInputStream getInputStream()
                                                throws java.io.IOException
Returns a ServletInputStream for streaming in the request. The content may not be the original HttpServletRequest content if modified within the filter chain.

Specified by:
getInputStream in interface javax.servlet.ServletRequest
Overrides:
getInputStream in class javax.servlet.ServletRequestWrapper
Returns:
ServletInputStream for streaming the HTTP content.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if unable to create the input stream.

getReader

public java.io.BufferedReader getReader()
                                 throws java.io.IOException
Returns a BufferedReader for reading the servlet request. The content may not be the original HttpServletRequest content if modified within the filter chain.

Specified by:
getReader in interface javax.servlet.ServletRequest
Overrides:
getReader in class javax.servlet.ServletRequestWrapper
Returns:
BufferedReader for reading the HTTP content.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if unable to create the reader.

setContent

public void setContent(byte[] content)
                throws java.io.IOException
Changes the HTTP content of the request. Any subsequent call to get a ServletInputStream or BufferedReader will gain access to this new content. Any open PrintWriters or ServletOutputStreams will be closed as a result of this call and new ones will have to be obtained.

Parameters:
content - New HTTP content of the request in bytes.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown if unable to change the content.

getContent

public byte[] getContent()
                  throws java.io.IOException
Returns the request content in bytes.

Returns:
HTTP content in bytes.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown if unable to return the content.

getContentLength

public int getContentLength()
Returns the length of the HTTP request content. This may not be the original content length if the content is modified within the filter chain.

Specified by:
getContentLength in interface javax.servlet.ServletRequest
Overrides:
getContentLength in class javax.servlet.ServletRequestWrapper
Returns:
integer containing the length of the request body or -1 if the length is not known

Returns the action to take on the request.

getContext

public java.lang.Object getContext()
Returns the message context of the request that need to be available for processing the response (or fault).

Returns:
Object representing the message context.

setContext

public void setContext(java.lang.Object context)
Changes the message context of the request. This will be used when processing the response (or fault).

Parameters:
context - Object representing the message context.

resetStream

public void resetStream()
                 throws java.io.IOException
Resets the stream of the request so that the content can be re-read from the beginning using either a ServletInputStream or BufferedReader. Any open PrintWriters or ServletOutputStreams will be closed as a result of this call and new ones will have to be obtained.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown if unable to close an open stream.
